Package model

Class PlayerBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.PlayerBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observable
public class PlayerBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable
This class represents one single physical game player board. It holds all the information about a player's status during the game, and has methods for executing many of the users actions.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerBoard

      public PlayerBoard​(Game game, java.lang.String username, int finalFaith, java.util.List<PopeFavorTile> popeFavorTiles)
      The class constructor
      Parameters:
      game - reference to the game the player is playing
      username - nickname that the player chose in the lobby
      popeFavorTiles - a List of the player's pope's favor tiles
      finalFaith - the faith amount that, once reached by the player, ends the game
      Throws:
      ParametersNotValidException - if the parameters for the constructor are not valid

      Constructor FOR TESTING

      public void addFaith​(int quantity)
      Increases the player's faith score by the given amount
      Parameters:
      quantity - the amount by which to increase the player's faith

    • addWhiteMarble

      public void addWhiteMarble​(int quantity)
      Depending on the number of available marble conversions: does nothing if there are zero, adds a resource of the corresponding type to the waiting room if there is one, and adds a white orb resource to the waiting room if there are multiple
      Parameters:
      quantity - the number of white marbles to add

    • chooseMarbleConversion

      public void chooseMarbleConversion​(ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughResourceException, ConversionNotAvailableException
      Converts the given amount of white orbs, from the amount waiting to be converted, into the given resource from the available marble conversions
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource into which to convert the white orb
      quantity - the amount of white orbs to convert
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if there are less white orbs in the waiting room than the amount to be converted
      ConversionNotAvailableException - if the conversion to the given resource is not available

    • sendResourceToDepot

      public void sendResourceToDepot​(int depot, ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws BlockedResourceException, WrongResourceInsertionException, NotEnoughSpaceException, DepotNotPresentException, NotEnoughResourceException
      Moves the given amount of the given resource from the waiting room to the selected depot
      Parameters:
      depot - the number of the depot to which to add the resource
      resource - the resource to be moved
      quantity - the amount of the resource to be moved
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if the number of the target depot does not correspond to any depot in the warehouse
      WrongResourceInsertionException - if the type of the resource to be added cannot (currently) be added to the target depot
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if the quantity of the resource to be added plus the amount already stored in the target depot exceeds the depot's maximum capacity
      BlockedResourceException - if the depot is affected by resource blocking and the resource is being blocked by a different depot
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the waiting room contains less than the given amount of the given resource

    • swapDepotContent

      public void swapDepotContent​(int depotNumber1, int depotNumber2) throws SwapNotValidException, DepotNotPresentException
      Swaps the contents of two warehouse depots
      Parameters:
      depotNumber1 - the number of the first depot
      depotNumber2 - the number of the second depot
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if one of the depot numbers given does not correspond with any depot
      SwapNotValidException - if the content of one or both of the depots cannot be transferred to the other

    • moveDepotContent

      public void moveDepotContent​(int depotNumberTake, int depotNumberGive, ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughSpaceException, WrongResourceInsertionException, BlockedResourceException, NotEnoughResourceException, DepotNotPresentException
      Moves a certain amount of resource from one depot to another
      Parameters:
      depotNumberTake - the number of the depot from which to take the resources
      depotNumberGive - the number of the depot to which to move the resources
      resource - the resource to move between the two depots
      quantity - the quantity of the resource to move
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if one of the depot numbers given does not correspond with any depot
      ParametersNotValidException - if the two inputs are the same number or below 1
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the given resource is not present in the providing depot in the amount to be deleted
      WrongResourceInsertionException - if the type of the resource to be added cannot (currently) be added to the receiving depot
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if the quantity of the resource to be added plus the amount already stored in the receiving depot exceeds the depot's maximum capacity
      BlockedResourceException - if the receiving depot is affected by resource blocking and the resource is being blocked by a different depot

    • buyDevelopmentCard

      public void buyDevelopmentCard​(DevelopmentCard card, int slot) throws SlotNotValidException, NotEnoughResourceException
      Checks if the player has the requisites for buying the selected development card. If so, it adds the card to the player's requested slot and adds its production to the production handler. The cost of the card is memorized in the waiting room, so that the player may choose where to take the resources from
      Parameters:
      card - the card to be bought by the player
      slot - the slot in which to put the card
      Throws:
      SlotNotValidException - if the selected slot cannot hold the selected card
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have the resources necessary for buying the card

    • addDevelopmentCardNoCheck

      public void addDevelopmentCardNoCheck​(int slot, DevelopmentCard developmentCard)
      Adds the specified DevelopmentCard to the specified slot in the player's PlayerBoard without making any checks (ONLY FOR TESTING)
      Parameters:
      slot - specifies to which production slot the Card must be added
      developmentCard - card that must be added

    • selectProduction

      public void selectProduction​(int number) throws ProductionNotPresentException
      Selects the production with the given number as part of those to activate during this turn
      Parameters:
      number - the number of the production
      Throws:
      ProductionNotPresentException - if there is no production corresponding to the given number

    • resetProductionChoice

      public void resetProductionChoice()
      Deselects all selected productions

    • confirmProductionChoice

      public void confirmProductionChoice() throws UndefinedJollyException, NotEnoughResourceException
      Checks if the player has converted all jollies in selected productions to other resources, and if they have enough resources to pay for productions
      Throws:
      UndefinedJollyException - if there are still undefined jollies in input or output
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have enough resources to activate the selected productions

    • chooseJollyInput

      public void chooseJollyInput​(Resource resource) throws ResourceNotPresentException
      Converts a jolly resource in current production input into the given resource
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource into which to turn the jolly
      Throws:
      ResourceNotPresentException - if the productions' input does not contain any more jollies

    • chooseJollyOutput

      public void chooseJollyOutput​(Resource resource) throws ResourceNotPresentException
      Converts a jolly resource in current production output into the given resource
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource into which to turn the jolly
      Throws:
      ResourceNotPresentException - if the productions' input does not contain any more jollies

    • releaseProductionOutput

      public void releaseProductionOutput()
      Prompts the board's production handler to release the active production's output to the player's storage

    • getNewTriggeredTile

      public int getNewTriggeredTile​(int lastTriggeredTile)
      Checks the player's pope's favor tiles, starting from the one with the highest index to not have yet been triggered up until last turn. Checks the necessity for a vatican report by checking the player's pope's favor tiles, starting from the one with the highest index to not have yet been triggered up until last turn. A tile is considered 'triggered' once a player's faith score has reached or surpassed the tile's faith score. Returns the tile with the highest index to have been triggered by the player during this turn (might be the same as the last)
      Parameters:
      lastTriggeredTile - the index of the tile the with the highest index that has been triggered (before this turn)
      Returns:
      the index of the tile the with the highest index that has been triggered (during this turn)

    • theVaticanReport

      public void theVaticanReport​(int newTriggeredTile, int lastTriggeredTile)
      The vatican will never be the same again.

      Checks if the player is in the activation area for any of the tiles starting from the first to have not yet been flipped before this turn, up to the last one flipped during this turn. During the check, each affected tile is either activated or discarded

      Parameters:
      newTriggeredTile - the index of the tile the with the highest index that has been triggered (during this turn)
      lastTriggeredTile - the index of the tile the with the highest index that has been triggered (before this turn)

    • takeResourceFromWarehouse

      public void takeResourceFromWarehouse​(int depotNumber, ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughResourceException, DepotNotPresentException
      Removes the given amount of the given resource from the given depot, as part of the player's choice of where to take resources to pay for the cost of a development card. If the player asks to pay a greater amount than that required by the cost, only the required amount is taken
      Parameters:
      depotNumber - the number of the depot from which to remove the resource
      resource - the resource to remove
      quantity - the amount of resource to remove
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the given resource is not present in the target depot in the amount to be deleted
      DepotNotPresentException - if the number of the target depot does not correspond to any depot in the warehouse

    • takeResourceFromStrongbox

      public void takeResourceFromStrongbox​(ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws NotEnoughResourceException
      Removes the given amount of the given resource from the player's strongbox, as part of the player's choice of where to take resources to pay for the cost a development card. If the player asks to pay a greater amount than that required by the cost, only the required amount is taken
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource to remove
      quantity - the amount of resource to remove
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the given resource is not present in the target depot in the amount to be deleted

      Parameters:

    • playLeaderCard

      public void playLeaderCard​(int number) throws LeaderRequirementsNotMetException, LeaderNotPresentException, CardAlreadyActiveException
      Checks if the player can activate a certain LeaderCard and activates it
      Parameters:
      number - specifies the position of the LeaderCard in the leaderCards list
      Throws:
      LeaderRequirementsNotMetException - thrown if the player does not fulfill the requirements to activate the specified LeaderCard
      LeaderNotPresentException - if the number selected does not correspond to a leader card
      CardAlreadyActiveException - if the selected card is already active

    • discardLeaderCard

      public void discardLeaderCard​(int number) throws LeaderIsActiveException, LeaderNotPresentException
      This method is called when a player decides to discard one of his two LeaderCards in order to get one faith point
      Parameters:
      number - specifies the position of the LeaderCard in the leaderCards list
      Throws:
      LeaderIsActiveException - if the leader card to be discarded has been activated
      LeaderNotPresentException - if the number selected does not correspond to a leader card

    • addMarbleConversion

      public void addMarbleConversion​(ResourceType resource)
      Adds the specified Resource to the marbleConversion list so that the player can convert a WhiteOrb into the Resource whenever he picks it from the Market
      Parameters:
      resource - Resource (specified in the LeaderCard) that the WhiteOrb can be transformed into from now on
